items.text: slices straight to third man. Looked to slap this over point but the bat face turned in his hand. Tamim took it well, didn't have to move an inch though.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nurse, OUT

dismissal.text: AR Nurse c Tamim Iqbal b Mustafizur Rahman 3 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 37.50

items.text: turns this full delviery towards long-on, wanted the second but realised he wouldn't have made it. 99

items.text: dabs this to the man coming in from point.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Paul, no run

items.text: pulled from outside off towards deep square. Splits the gap beautifully.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Paul, FOUR runs

items.text: beaten by a slower delivery that he tried to defend.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Paul, no run

items.text: late on the flashy cut, thin edge and Mushfiqur takes a good, low catch diving forward. It's the skid that gets batsmen more often than not. Excellent from Rubel.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Paul, OUT

dismissal.text: KMA Paul c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 4 (4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00

items.text: drives this full delivery to cover.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Bishoo, no run

items.text: slices this to deep point and brings up a second ODI century. Wherever you are, please stand up to applaud a fine, fine knock. He is now the youngest West Indian to score an ODI century at home
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hetmyer, 1 run

items.text: chopped on! There's a real danger now that Hetmyer will be left high and dry. Looks to ease this with an angled bat, very lazy, very late on the stroke and gone.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Bishoo, OUT

dismissal.text: D Bishoo  b Mustafizur Rahman 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.preText: MahneelMusa: "Brilliant brilliant stuff from young Hetmyer. Picking the gaps, rotating strike and hitting the bad ones, text book example of an ideal ODI innings!"
items.text: beaten by a fizzing off-cutter which he looked to bunt into the off side.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Joseph, no run

items.text: big swing, no connection, beaten.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Joseph, no run
Mustafizur Rahman to Joseph, no run

items.preText: Andrew : "*** 2nd ODI ton for Shimron Hetmyer!" -- Thanks for the correction. Glanced through his Test number for a minute. Cheers
items.text: beaten by a full delivery he slants away.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Joseph, no run

items.text: how far has he hit this? Very, far. Another super connection to this swing acoss the line to a short of length delivery. Stand and deliver. This is simply incredible, we're seeing the coming of age of someone who we will hear of for a long, long time hopefully.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, SIX runs

items.text: full toss angling away, slash and a miss. This one's well outside the wide line, called correctly.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, 1 wide

items.text: takes a step across and then wallops this short ball behind square. The step across may have been to throw the bowler off guard, but he would've hit it even if he didn't take it. Clean striking right out of the top drawer.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, SIX runs

items.text: high full toss, swung across the line to long-on, where there's a misfield so they take two. Called no-ball for height. Hetmyer will now get a free hit. Bangladesh are letting this slip bigtime after controlling the innings
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, (no ball) 2 runs

items.text: slices this full toss past the cover fielder.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, 2 runs

items.text: swung across the line, on the bounce to long-on
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, 1 run

items.text: yorker-length delivery that he slips down leg, wide called.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Joseph, 1 wide

items.text: right into the blockhole, squeezes an inside edge onto the pad as they scamper a run
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Joseph, 1 run

items.preText: Andrew Campbell: "Ive watch many young cricketers coming through the ranks and it really irked the I when they had him on the bench...he's showing what he is truly capable of...go Hetmyer!"
items.text: into the blockhole, nudged around the corner to deep square. 22 off the over
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, 1 run

items.text: walks across to swing, but misses. This full toss dipped on him
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: he's clobbered this clean. Picked the bones out of it. Full toss again, took a step across and then hammered it over wide long-on
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hetmyer, SIX runs

items.text: backs away and drills this full delivery to deep point, risky second that he was always struggling to complete. The throw is superb, and Mushfiqur doesn't take much time to whip the bails off. Just short of the crease.
items.postText: Tasmeem: "One thing hasn't changed for Bangladesh over the years. And that is closing out opposition innings on a high. Always struggle to get the last few wickets and leak runs. It's gonna be a tricky chase. " MahneelMusa: "Great spirit by Bangladesh to stop and acknowledge pure brilliance from Hetmyer, thoroughly deserved. But hope people who bash Bangladesh for their alleged lack of spirit are watching this." jameson: "Any demons in the pitch that could stop BD from being able to chase this total? I don't think BD let this match go, I think Rubel did. So fresh from the memories of his poor match-losing over in the Nidahas final. Poor from an experienced bowler." -- That 22-run over notwithstanding, I thought he was largely decent. It can happen to anyone in cricket. 6.15pm Bangladesh controlled this innings for the first 30 overs, courtesy their spinners, and then let this slip. That they're chasing 272 for a series win is down to a magnificent second ODI century from a 20-year old - Shimron Hetmyer - whose name we will hear of for a long time to come. The manner in he maneuvered the field and played to the situation along with the lower middle order a stand out. Towards the death, his improvisation and clean ball-striking stood out. All in all, it bodes well for West Indies, who have been looking to fill the top order gaps. As good as Hetmyer was, the rescue act wouldn't have been possible without the century stand with Rovman Powell. On a slow pitch Bishoo has the experience of bowling on - he is from Guyana - West Indies should be confident of defending this to take the series into the decider. Can they do it? We'll find out in a few hours. Join Akshay in 30 minutes for the chase. You don't want to miss it.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hetmyer, 1 run, OUT

dismissal.text: SO Hetmyer run out (Mehidy Hasan Miraz/†Mushfiqur Rahim) 125 (93b 3x4 7x6) SR: 134.40
